main event: A civilian reported seeing a silver object, the size of a nickel at arm's length, traveling faster than a jet in Van Nuys, California on 28 July 1955.
interesting points: The object was described as moving faster than a jet, indicating high speed.
The size of the object at arm's length was compared to that of a nickel, suggesting it was relatively small.
The civilian's drawing of the object supported their memory of the sighting.
The report indicated that the characteristics data for evaluation were unknown, leaving the sighting unexplained.
The sighting lasted for 30 seconds, providing a relatively short observation period.
